column3: About time you noticed! Here I was wondering if you were gonna watch grass grow all morning...
the sun’s only been out for a few minutes
column4: aren’t you supposed to be busy crowing to wake everyone up? Maybe circling over some carrion?
doofus. Maybe spend a little less time thinking about birds and a little more timedigging the wax outta those...
the dew point around here is constantly fluctuating
column5: and the humidity is gonna eat away at those plants’ caudex turning them all goopy
column6: but you’d KNOW all that if you ever bothered to show up to—

column3: Yeah. It’s for her. Pineberries were always her favorite. I guessed...
they’d be here for her. I know

column5: you know as well as I do
column6: if anyone could survive out there

column5: why don’t we hold off on the whole past tensing her just yet

column3: See! There’s the dummy I know—
Now get those seeds outta the ground before I give your face a the plot of dirt right next to em...
did you really come all the way down here just to give me a lecture on seed ethics
column4: or are you just that nosy?

column3: OOPS!!! I almost forgot!! I caught up with your mom by the greenhouse; she said she finished taking a look at your invention! She’s probably waiting for us back at the institute so let’s get moving.
